'''''Cortinarius flexipes''''' is a fungus, specifically a [[mushroom]], a small brown species in the genus ''[[Cortinarius]]''. It is commonly known as the '''Pelargonium webcap''' because of its unusual smell of ''[[Pelargonium]]'' (the household "geranium").

This species of mushroom is found in [[Europe]] and [[North America]]. It is [[hygrophanous]], and  belongs to the ''Telamonia'' group, being thin-fleshed and having a dry [[pileus (mycology)|cap]] and [[stipe (mycology)|stipe]].

==Synonymy==
'''''Cortinarius paleaceus''''' ([[Weinm.]]) [[Elias Magnus Fries|Fr.]] and '''''Cortinarius paleiferus''''' Svrek  (sometimes written ''C. paleifer''<ref name=Courtecuisse>Courtecuisse, R. & Duhem, B. (1994) "Guide des champignons de France et d'Europe" Delachaux et Niestlé {{ISBN|2-603-00953-2}}, also available in English.</ref>) have commonly been identified in Europe as separate species.<ref name=Courtecuisse/><ref>{{cite book|author=Meinhard Moser, translated by Simon Plant|title=''Keys to Agarics and Boleti''|publisher=Roger Phillips|year=1983|isbn=0-9508486-0-3}}</ref><ref>See also the entry in [http://www.indexfungorum.org/Names/SynSpecies.asp?RecordID=461923 Index Fungorum] for the current name and synonyms.</ref> ''C. paleiferus'' is defined as having more widely spaced [[lamella (mycology)|gills]], and has a pale violet [[mycelium]] at the base of the [[stipe (mycology)|stipe]].  Now these types are combined into one species and considered to be only [[variety (botany)|varieties]] of ''C. flexipes''.<ref>{{cite journal|author=A. Ortega & F. Esteve-Raventós|title=Taxonomic studies on Iberian ''Cortinarius'': Some ''Telamonia'' species with ''Pelargonium'' smell and comments on ''C. sertipes'' f. ''contrarius''|journal=Österreichische Zeitschrift für Pilzkunde |year=2003 |volume=12 |pages=1–11}}</ref>

==Description==
''Cortinarius flexipes'' [[Pileus (mycology)|cap]] is up to {{convert|3|cm}}. It is dark brown but becoming pale [[fawn (color)|fawn]] on drying, with white hair-like scales especially near the edge.  It is more or less pointed in the centre. The stipe is up to about {{convert|7|cm}} and fibrous, with white bands of [[veil (botany)|veil]] remnants. Fruitbodies have the smell of ''[[Pelargonium]]'' (household geranium).
